title: Sumset
content: A + B = {a + b : a ∈ A, b ∈ B}. Central object in additive combinatorics.

title: Counting Function
content: A(x) = |A ∩ [1,x]|. Measures density of sets up to x.

title: Exact Additive Complement
content: A,B with A+B covering all large integers and A(x)B(x) ~ x. Optimally sparse complements.

title: Erdős-Danzer Question (Solved)
content: For exact additive complements, does A(x)B(x) - x → ∞?

title: Danzer (1964)
content: Exact additive complements exist. Initially surprising result.

title: Sárközy-Szemerédi (1994)
content: A(x)B(x) - x → ∞ for exact additive complements. Solves the main question affirmatively.

title: Ruzsa (2017)
content: Growth to ∞ can be arbitrarily slow: for any w(x) → ∞, ∃ exact complements with A(x)B(x) - x < w(x) i.o.

title: Problem Summary
content: SOLVED: YES, A(x)B(x) - x → ∞ (Sárközy-Szemerédi 1994). Growth can be arbitrarily slow (Ruzsa 2017).
